intro: Ponthieva unguiculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom throughout the year under proper care. Ponthieva unguiculata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
